metadata.abstractText: We present in this paper our law that there is always a connection present between two entities, with a selfconnection being present at least in each node. An entity is an object, physical or imaginary, that is connected by a path (or connection) and which is important for achieving the desired result of the scenario. In machine learning, we state that for any scenario, a subject entity is always, directly or indirectly, connected and affected by single or multiple independent / dependent entities, and their impact on the subject entity is dependent on various factors falling into the categories such as the existence of entity, the inner state of the entity, the external state of the entity and the state of communication of the entity.
